reviewText: Dr. Baden is a forensic medical examiner in charge of determing death of individuals. This dvd has the first 2 episondes of the HBO documentary series "Autopsy " that aired in the 1990's. I am hoping they some day offer the entire series in a set. Forensics is such a fascinating & in some cultures a taboo subject.
Title: N/A

reviewText: There are about 6 Autopsy shows.  I soon realized there's more to the show than the chilling sounds in the background.  Every episode of Autopsy is great and shows the brilliance of Dr Baden. The Autopsy Files is no exception.  I'm puzzled as to why HBO has not released the entire series on DVD. Luckily, I have episodes from VHS (transferred to DVD).
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have been addicted to this sow since it debuted over a decade ago on HBO!Dr. Michael Baden is GENIUS! Listening to him explain all the details (no matter how gory) and how the crime puzzle fits together is both fascinating and remarkable.HBO has always be consistant with delivering the top of the line in entertainment. I only hope we can look forward to further autopsy releases.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a great dvd on "Autopsy". It covers a brief history of autopsy from past to present. It gets into the science of the autopsy itself with detailed information. An excellent training tool!
Title: N/A

reviewText: First, let me state my overall opinion of this DVD."Buy it." If you are at all interested in what the forensic pathologist does, this would be a wise purchase. I did not grow up watching this show and have just discovered it.But, I must be frank about the contents. This show is going on 15 years old, and while very well made, it is tame by todays standards. There is no actual autopsy performed. This show was really a template of todays csi-type programs found on the cable networks. Many of the actual "body shots" are shown in a muted color scheme to flush out the gruesome hues...like I said it is the prototype of the existing narrative driven mystery-death cases you see a hundred programs of today.If you are wanting an all out DVD which takes you through a whole autopsy then I would purchase Dr. Naguchi's Autopsy DVD Voices of the Dead.I am glad I have this DVD in my collection and think if you are reading this review you probably should have it, too!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This rating was choosen because this DVD was not what I thought it would be. But I did enjoy it. The DVD it self was in good condition on it's arrival.
summary: Review on the DVD "The Autopsy Files" by Michael Baden

reviewText: The eerie background music and the matter of fact narration just creeps me out. Saw these when they aired on HBO late at night. The crimes are truly terryifying that they present. Real crime scene photos go with the stories but not the actually autopsy. Wish all seasons were on DVD but most are on Youtube at least. If your a fan of Forensic File shows you will appreciate this. Note that segments run about 10 minutes or so, some more in depth than others.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The cases are interesting, but it's a bit of an overload, as too many cases are covered in too little time.  There was no real information about King Tut.  Some of the cases are very disturbing.
